thread.title: Police chief says Whittier officer's slaying shows danger of criminal justice reform, but details are unclear - LA Times
thread.title_full: Police chief says Whittier officer's slaying shows danger of criminal justice reform, but details are unclear - LA Times

author: Richard Winton
title: Police chief says Whittier officer's slaying shows danger of criminal justice reform, but details are unclear - LA Times
text:
Police chief says Whittier officer's slaying shows danger of criminal justice reform, but details are unclear Whittier police shooting Michael Owen Baker / For The Times Whittier Police Chief Jeff Piper, right, and other law enforcement personnel escort the body of a slain Whittier police officer from UC Irvine Medical Center. Whittier Police Chief Jeff Piper, right, and other law enforcement personnel escort the body of a slain Whittier police officer from UC Irvine Medical Center. (Michael Owen Baker / For The Times) Richard Winton Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss 
Army Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster is Trump’s new national security advisor. Officer Keith Boyer spent 27 years patrolling the streets of Whittier. It's legal for an ICE agent to pretend to be an officer in an immigration raid. But should it be? Bernie Sanders spoke in downtown L.A. on Sunday.

Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders speaks about a working class world while discussing his new book “Our Revolution” with Los Angeles Times columnist and political cartoonist, David Horsey, at the Ideas Exchange event in The Theatre at Ace Hotel in Los Angeles on Feb. 19, 2017.
